title: State Street to Buy Brown Brothers Harriman Investor Services for $3.5 Billion; Deal includes BBH Investor Services' custody, accounting, fund administration, global markets and technology services
text:
State Street said the deal will support its services through data-connectivity tools and by expanding in non-U.S. markets such as Japan, Luxembourg, Ireland and Latin America.

The deal could add to State Street's per-share earnings in the first year, it said. The company said the deal will result in expense savings of $260 million in the third year as a result of efficiencies in operational systems and infrastructure, as well as overhead consolidation.

State Street said it expects to fund the transaction primarily through the issuance of common equity, the suspension of common share repurchases before resuming in the second quarter of 2022 and cash on hand.

BBH Investor Services employees will join State Street, and its senior management team will become State Street executives, the companies said. Sean Pairceir, currently partner and global head of investor services at BBH, will join State Street's management committee, they added.

The companies said they are targeting the deal's closing by year-end.
